snippet: The Western & Southern Open, also known as the Cincinnati Masters, is the lone suburban stop for most of the world’s best players, forcing them to adapt to staples of American life.
abstract: Tennis stars competing in the Western & Southern Open south of Cincinnati, the lone suburban stop for most of the world's best players, are forced to adapt to the staples of American life; nearby Applebee's restaurant has long been popular among competitors for its reliable food and long hours.
lead_paragraph: The Western & Southern Open, also known as the Cincinnati Masters, is the lone suburban stop for most of the world’s best players, forcing them to adapt to staples of American life.

headline.main: Tennis Stars Touch Down in the Midwest, and They Crave Applebee’s
headline.print_headline: Tournament Stars Touch Down in the Midwest, and They Crave Applebee’s
